itemDescription: British dealer in antiquarian rare books and works on paper

wikipedia_page.main: Bernard John Shapero (born August 1963) is a British dealer in antiquarian rare books and works on paper, the founder of Shapero Rare Books of 106 New Bond Street, Mayfair, London. In 2005, Slate called him "London's most successful rare-book dealer and arguably the top dealer in the world today".

One of them, the Doria Atlas, was sold to Bernard Shapero in October 2005 for £1.46 million, a new record price for an atlas.

Repair costs, in addition to Wardington's advanced age and frailty, forced a sale of 700 items from the collection. The Doria Atlas was sold at auction by Sotheby's in October 2005. Initially expected to fetch £700,000 to £1 million, it ultimately was purchased by Bernard Shapero, a London rare book dealer, for £1.46 million. Its sale price was the highest ever for an atlas, a record surpassed by the Cosmographia the following year.
